document.masterDocTitle: Species relationships in the Neotropical genus Phareicranaus Roewer 1913 (Opiliones: Cranaidae): two new species and new data from Penial morphology

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Species relationships in the Neotropical genus Phareicranaus Roewer 1913 (Opiliones: Cranaidae): two new species and new data from Penial morphology

bibRefCitation.author: Roewer

.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The same diagnosis as Pinto-da-Rocha &
Kury ( 2003
: 181 ) give for
Santinezia .

Justification of the synonymies. Both type species of
Acanthocranaus
and
Comboyus
present a ventral spur on male coxa IV and penis with folded glans, diagnostic characteristics traditionally regarded as typical of the genus
Santinezia
. However, type species of
Phareicranaus
,
P. calcariferus
, presents a tubercle on male coxa IV larger than other ventral tubercles and homologous to the ventral spur of
Santinezia
. In addition, the type species of these three genera share paired spines on ocularium, area III and tergite III, as well as area II invading I, features present in all species here assigned to
Phareicranaus
.
